Key Match Events: Ecuador scored the first goal in the 25th minute with a rebound left by the goalkeeper for the striker Angel Mena to just push the ball into the net.
Pre-Game Insights: Ecuador is the favorite to take the 3 points due to their better moment and quality of players.
Ecuador is in a better position with 5 points and a record of 2 wins, 2 draws and a loss.
Chile is in 8th position with 5 points and a record of one game won, two draws and two defeats.
Post-Match Reflections: Ecuador took the 3 points in this match day 6 in the Conmebol Qualifiers for the 2026 World Cup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Estadio Rodrigo Paz Delgado.
The match was not broadcast on television but can be streamed on Marca Claro on Youtube or VAVEL Mexico.
Others: The referee in charge of the match was Anderson Daronco.
The two teams have no injured or suspended players.
